admin.title: Mainnet Administration
admin.subtitle: Control and monitor TBURN mainnet infrastructure
admin.rateLimitedMessage: Rate Limited by TBURN Mainnet API - Retrying connections
admin.rateLimitDescription: The TBURN API is rejecting requests due to rate limiting (HTTP 429).
admin.apiErrorDescription: The TBURN API returned an error response (HTTP 500/502).
admin.networkErrorDescription: Failed to establish connection to TBURN mainnet API.
admin.offlineDescription: The mainnet appears to be offline or unresponsive.
admin.partialFailure: Partial failure - showing stale cached data
admin.historicalFailures: Historical API failures stored locally - Not current errors
admin.takingLongerThanExpected: Taking longer than expected - External API may be rate-limiting
admin.controlPanelDescription: Administrative actions for TBURN mainnet infrastructure
admin.restartDescription: Triggers a clean server restart via process.exit(0). Replit will automatically restart the service within 5-10 seconds.
admin.healthCheckDescription: Performs a comprehensive health check on the mainnet infrastructure and reports status.
admin.behavior1: Server receives restart command and shuts down cleanly
admin.behavior3: Service reconnects to production mainnet at tburn1.replit.app
admin.behavior4: Fresh data polling begins, block production resumes
admin.behavior5: Status changes from PAUSED â†’ ACTIVE, TPS returns to normal
admin.recoveryDescription: Service restart: 5-10 seconds (automatic) | Data sync: 10-20 seconds | Full recovery: 30-60 seconds total. Monitor "Last Block" and "Current TPS" metrics above to confirm successful restart.
admin.restartAction3: Reconnect to mainnet and resume data polling
admin.passwordAuthHint: Enter your admin password to authorize this operation.
admin.healthCheckIntro: This will perform a comprehensive health check on the TBURN mainnet infrastructure.
admin.restartInitiatedDesc: Server is restarting. Progress will be tracked automatically.
admin.restartFailedDesc: Failed to restart mainnet. Check server logs.
